title: Report: Bill Russell’s widow sues his daughter over breach of contract
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Jeannine Russell, Bill Russell's widow, sues his daughter Karen Russell for breach of contract over legacy-damaging statements.
Karen Russell allegedly breached a confidentiality agreement by discussing Bill Russell's cognitive issues in a Boston Globe column.
The lawsuit follows a 2015 dispute over Bill Russell's competency, which was settled with written agreements including nondisparagement terms.

title: Pavel Zacha’s Olympic dream turned into a nightmare due to ill-timed injury
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Pavel Zacha missed the 2026 Winter Olympics due to an upper-body injury sustained on January 29.
Zacha's injury decision was mutual with the Czech National Team and Boston Bruins after no significant improvement.
Zacha participated in a non-contact practice, aiming to return for Boston Bruins' game against Columbus on February 27.

title: Trump admin responds to lawsuit from Healey aide over work authorization
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Valentina Amaro Bowser, a Healey media director, sues Trump administration over visa policies risking her job loss.
Trump administration claims Massachusetts federal court lacks jurisdiction, citing national security concerns in response to the lawsuit.
Bowser, a Venezuelan immigrant, awaits permanent residency after marrying a U.S. citizen; her H-1B visa expired Feb. 14.

title: Review & setlist: Nine Inch Nails get cinematic at TD Garden
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Nine Inch Nails performed a 21-song, 100-minute set at TD Garden, featuring rare tracks and a mesmerizing stage show.
Boston hosted one of two repeat shows on the band's 'Peel It Back' tour, including several songs not played in 2025.
Frontman Trent Reznor collaborated with Boys Noize and incorporated EDM influences into tracks like a remix of 'Closer.'

title: Southie roommates built a massive igloo that went viral on social media. Then the vandals showed up.
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: South Boston roommates built a massive igloo, gaining 40 million social media views before it was vandalized.
Jack Tarca and his roommates spent over 100 hours constructing an 8.5-foot-tall igloo using ice bricks.
The igloo was destroyed by two men with a sledgehammer, leaving only a few iPhone photos of the structure.

title: Is Dunkin’ really giving out free left-handed mittens?
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Dunkin' will give away left-handed 'iced coffee gloves' with iced beverage purchases starting 10 a.m. Feb. 20.
The promo aims to provide 'insulation for your sipping hand' during cold weather at participating locations.
The gloves are part of winter-themed merchandise, including a ski suit in Dunkin's signature colors.

title: James Van Der Beek’s best performances streaming now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: James Van Der Beek, known for 'Dawson's Creek,' passed away at 48; revisit his standout roles this weekend.
'Dawson’s Creek' (1998-2003) showcased Van Der Beek's iconic role as Dawson Leery in a teen drama on Netflix, Hulu, Tubi.
Van Der Beek's role in 'Varsity Blues' (1999) as the brainy quarterback Mox can be streamed on Paramount+ and Pluto TV.

title: A Love Letters phone booth is at the Boston Public Library
author: Meredith Goldstein
bullets: A 'Tell-A-Booth' for leaving anonymous relationship queries was installed at Boston Public Library on February 12.
The booth, created with the American Repertory Theater's help, allows users to share questions or stories via an old-school phone.
Meredith Goldstein responds to topics from romance to friendship, fostering community engagement with the Love Letters column.

title: If Boston had its own ‘Winter Olympics,’ what would the events be?
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Boston Reddit users propose unique events for a hypothetical 'Winter Olympics,' inspired by local challenges and culture.
Proposed events include 'Spot Saver Curling,' 'Storrow Drive Limbo,' and Dunkin-themed challenges like 'Iced Dunks Toss.'
The Reddit thread features over 80 user suggestions, highlighting Boston's winter hardships and quirky local customs.

title: Jaylen Brown has conversation with Dana White as he toys with idea of future career in UFC after NBA
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Celtics guard Jaylen Brown is considering a post-NBA career in boxing or UFC fighting, per All-Star weekend comments.
Brown has discussed his potential UFC interest with Dana White and recently trained Muay Thai at the UFC Performance Institute.
Brown's wide array of interests includes his apparel brand 741 Performance and community work through the 7uice Foundation.
